titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Houston area land records for the Little, Dickson and Pastoriza additions, 1877-1935
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Todd Samuelson

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Philip Montgomery , Fondren Library February 24, 2003

change.item: Edited by Mandy York with XMetal 3 according to instructions in TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University, Houston, TX

did.unittitle: Houston area land records for the Little, Dickson and Pastoriza additions
did.abstract: This collection consists of 11 abstracts of title and one warranty deed for property in the city of Houston and Harris County, filed from 1877 to 1935.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 11 abstracts of title and one warranty deed for property in the city of Houston and Harris County, filed from 1877 to 1935. The first series deals with property in the R.J. Little Addition, north side of Buffalo Bayou, and the John Dickinson Addition, north side of Buffalo Bayou. The warranty deed was for property belonging to Martha J. Blalock. The second series of property was part of the Pastoriza Addition, southside of Buffalo Bayou from the Luke Moore League (survey).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in one box with each of the two series consisting of items donated by the individual whose name is included in the series title where the item is located.

list.item: Series I. Gift of Mrs. Clifton N. Hancock; property North of Buffalo Bayou, 1902-1910.
Series II. Gift of Mrs. Ida Siegel; property south of Buffalo Bayou. 1877-1935, n.d.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from the Little, Dickson and Pastoriza families Houston land records must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Little, Dickson and Pastoriza familes Houston land records, MS432, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The first series of three abstracts and one deed was given to the Woodson by Mrs. Clifton N. Hancock in December 1987. The second series was given by Mrs. Ida Siegel in January 1987.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: No future additions are expected for this material.

did.unittitle: Series I: Gift of Mrs. Clifton N. Hancock, 1902-1910.

scopecontent.p: Containing abstracts of title for property north of Buffalo bayou, and a warranty deed for property belonging to Martha J. Blalaock, 1902-1910.

Series II: Gift of Mrs. Ida Siegel

scopecontent.p: Containing abstracts of title for property south of Buffalo Bayou. 1877-1935, n.d.

did.unittitle: Supplemental Abstract of Title. For "15.53 acres out of the Southern portion of the East half of Lot 1 of the West half of the Luke Moore League, ... Harris County, Texas."

Abstract of Title no. 31948. For "Lot no. 12, block no. 5 of Pastoriza Addition to the City of Houston."
did.unitdate: n.d. With copy of 1906 abstract attached.
